title: Consecration of the Firstborn and Guidance by God
summary: Exodus 13 explains the consecration of every firstborn to God and the celebration of Passover. As the Israelites journey into the wilderness, God leads them with a pillar of cloud by day and fire by night.

faq.question: Why did God command the consecration of the firstborn?
faq.answer: As a reminder that He spared Israelâ€™s firstborn during the tenth plague.

faq.question: How did God guide the Israelites?
faq.answer: By a pillar of cloud during the day and a pillar of fire at night.
